column4: Anyone know why I cant sudo modprobe acerhdf? I get fatal errors
listing said errors might be useful
acerhdf.ko): No such device
But when I hit the tab key, acerhdf is one of the modules listed so I know its installed. Plus its been included in the kernel since 9.10
Either you don't have the device that it uses, or you need to load another module before acerhdf can see the device... Can you give me your laptop model?
Acer aspire one ao532h its a netbook
sorry, xchat crashed just a moment ago
If I ls this directory: /lib/modules/2.6.35-23-generic/kernel/drivers/platform/x86/ it finds acerhdf.ko....
It's not a matter of finding the module... THe module can't find the hardware
Duh, gotcha. Reading is extremely helpful lol
So do you know the model of your laptop? often these types of problems are model-specific, and someone has already solved it.
Post 2 is my answer http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1540740
Thanks tho, I thought h/w didnt matter ha
Is it still safe to use it if its not supported?
as anglican explained on forum post, use at your own risk. In short, it just means the module hasn't been tested with your BIOS version.
Whats the worst that could happen?
The worst I see happening is it freezes your system, but it could always be worse
Computers are weird sometimes
but seeing as computers tend to be more robust nowadays, I don't think it would do anything catastrophic
Thanks for your help :)
np
